COURSES.name: Introduction to Financial Accounting
COURSES.description: Conceptual introduction to financial accounting. Emphasis is placed on wealth and income measurement and the preparation and interpretation of conventional financial statements.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 10014 REQUIRES ONLINE PROCTORING FOR EXAMS. YOU WILL NEED   A WEBCAM AND HIGH SPEED INTERNET ACCESS FOR THIS COURSE.

COURSES.name: Introduction to Managerial Accounting
COURSES.description: Accounting for cost reporting and control. Reports, statements and analytical tools used by management.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 10111 HAS LECTURES AND OTHER ASSIGNMENTS AVAILABLE ONLINE   EXAMS ARE PROCTORED IN THE EVENINGS ON THE UF CAMPUS.    FOR LECTURE RECORDING TIME &ENINGS ON THE UF LOCATION GO TO HTTP://WARRINGTON.UFL.EDU/HEAVENER/LECTURES

COURSES.name: Financial Accounting and Reporting 1
COURSES.description: Covers the theoretical structure of financial accounting, required financial statements, revenue recognition, operating assets and current liabilities.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ACG 2021 and ACG 2071 with minimum grades of B.

COURSES.name: Business Processes and Accounting Information System
COURSES.description: Examination of the accounting information systems in a business organization. Coverage extends over topics such as business processes, internal controls, and the fundamentals of accounting information systems analysis, design, implementation and control.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 4; Prereq: ACG 2021 and ACG 2071 with minimum grades of B, and CGS 2531.

COURSES.name: Professional Speakers Series
COURSES.description: To expose students to technical topics and emerging issues in accounting, business and related professions such as law. The course addresses career opportunities in the practice of public accounting, industry, financial services, government, and in business more generally. (S-U)

COURSES.name: Financial Accounting and Reporting 2
COURSES.description: Continuation of ACG 3101 and includes coverage of accounting for investments, non-current liabilities and equities, accounting for income taxes, derivatives, accounting changes, statement of cash flows and earnings per share.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ACG 3101 with minimum grade of C and FIN 3403.

COURSES.name: Cost and Managerial Accounting
COURSES.description: Extends cost and managerial coverage beyond that covered in ACG 2071. Topics include quantitative cost estimation, standard costing, flexible budgets, inventory management, pricing d
